intro: Haworthia marumiana, commonly known as the marble cactus, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a compact rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are adorned with white or pale yellow markings. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or yellow during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or container cultivation. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
